item.title: 一些语言学的梗和有意思的知识
item.description: This post is written in Chinese. If you don’t know Chinese, you can learn it lol. (Sorry for this because simply translating the post into English may not be enough for you to understand). 纯玩梗 语言现象背后蕴含的知识 皮钦语 (pidgin) 大家对那些 1.言语中不时夹杂着英文单

item.title: Possible Research Areas in Mechanistic Interpretability
item.description: The Purpose I Write This Blog To get started in mech interp research, we need to have a macro understanding of this area. So I write this blog as a summarization of this field to help you and me choose a research topic. Circuit Discovery Methods basic activation patching (causal mediation/interchange interventions…) path patching scaling techinques: attribution patching DAS (distributed alignment search) directional activation patching? 🔭 resources inspirition Analyzing Multi-Head

item.title: Exploring Emotional Features in GPT2-Small
item.description: 🎶Code in this post can be found at the jupyter notebook in my “saeExploration” repo. Find features that reflect positive emotions To find the features related to a specific emotion, I write five sentences containing the key words for each emotion. For example, for happy emotions I have: 1 2 3 4 5 prompt_happy = ["I'll be on a vacation tomorrow and I'm so happy.", "My mombrings home a new puppy and I'm so happy.

item.title: A Brief Introduction to Mechanistic Interpretability Research
item.description: The purpose I write this blog Mechanistic Interpretability is a new field in machine learning that aims to reverse engineering complicated model structures to something clear, understandable and hopefully controllable for our humans. The study of this field is still at a young age and facing mountains of challenges. While for beginners (like me), there are lots of terms or ideas which are not so familiar (e.g. superposition, circuits, activation patching, etc).
